revised_title: Radar Backscatter and Surface Roughness Measurements for Stationary Breaking Waves: A Laboratory Study
tldr: This study examines the relationship between wave-breaking and radar backscatter in stationary breaking waves generated by a stationary submerged hydrofoil in a uniform stream. The authors characterize the surface roughness and radar backscatter, and evaluate simple models that relate the two. They find that the Bragg model, which explains radar backscatter from small-scale surface disturbances, has some shortcomings when applied to the breaking region due to large surface height variations.
